Stem: Rectangular, with lengthways grooves, and either hairless or hairy.
Leaves: Oval-shaped up to 9 cm long, on very short stalks and with pointed tips. Sparsely hairy, particularly on veins.
Flowers: Tubular white flowers in clusters of 10 or more. On very short stalks.
FruitSeeds: Narrowly oval-shaped capsule 6-8 mm long containing about 20 seeds.
DistinguishingFeatures: Much larger plant than native Willow hygro (*Hygrophila angustifolia*).
